definition: to become civilized/to be open-minded/(of ice) to thaw

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
variant of 花[hua1]
to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
Kaihua county in Quzhou 衢州[Qu2 zhou1], Zhejiang
semicivilized

sentences.english: Supposing that the chimpanzees were to be civilized by us, would they be happer for it?
sentences.chinese: 就算咱们把猩猩都开化了，它们因此更幸福吗？

sentences.english: Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian , slave and free;
sentences.chinese: 未开化的，奴隶或自由人等的分别。

sentences.english: His book describes the march of the civilization of a primitive society.
sentences.chinese: 他的“着作”描述了一个原始社会的开化过程。

sentences.english: Sceptics point out that due process requires discretion.
sentences.chinese: 怀疑派则指出应该谨慎推行公开化。

sentences.english: Some say it is wild and uncivilized.
sentences.chinese: 有些人说这是一片未开化的蛮荒之地。

sentences.english: Although there is no small favors, but the price open, product quality is not bad.
sentences.chinese: 虽然没有小恩小惠，但价格公开化，商品质量还不错。

sentences.english: It's not that we are not enlightened, we just had a different history.
sentences.chinese: 并非是我们不开化，只是我们的历史情况不同。

sentences.english: Schools will help to civilize the wild tribes there.
sentences.chinese: 学校教育将有助于使那里的野蛮部落逐步开化。

sentences.english: The original porcelain factory, will build for becoming civilized in the temple in ancient times under the foot of large Foshan of Rong County.
sentences.chinese: 荣县大佛山脚下原来的瓷厂，将修建为古时的开化寺。

sentences.english: It requires confidence, openness, and letting go of defenses.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程需要信心，开化以及放开戒备。

sentences.english: The tribal dance was a spectacle of barbaric splendour.
sentences.chinese: 部落舞展示了一场五颜六色的半开化先民的奇观。

sentences.english: It typically explodes into the open at some point.
sentences.chinese: 它通常会在某个时间点上突然公开化。

sentences.english: The first section is The Civilization Of The Ancient Ling Nati.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分《古代岭南的开化》。

sentences.english: And this semi-public link to the broader net leaves vital systems potentially open to attack.
sentences.chinese: 这种半公开化的宽带连接让重要的系统容易受到袭击。

sentences.english: That opened up in public the possibility that the currency union might not be forever.
sentences.chinese: 此举将欧元区不会永远存续的可能性公开化了。
就像是未曾开化的运算系统。
